history.content:
Both sounds really rough, I wouldn't recommend it. According to @11677 there could be an alternative to having large exams by having periodical quizzes instead, so that may ease the workload a bit, but that doesn't change the fact that 162 involves tons of project work and that's where most of the workload lies. 188 has projects, problem sets, and exams, so that will also be pretty challenging if only slightly less work than 162 would be. If you want numbers, 162 is roughly 15 hrs a week with a pretty good project group during the semester, so probably 25ish over the summer. 188 probably 15-20ish hours a week over the summer. Given studying and all that, I'd say probably at least 50 hrs a week total on the two classes.

It may be a good idea, however, to just take 162 alone, especially if the instructors do decide to scrap large exams--could be a perfect opportunity to take it and just enjoy/get the most out of the projects. Also, if COVID-19 is still a big issue this summer as people anticipate it will be, do you really want all that stress caused by two whole techs squeezed into 8 weeks? I wouldn't, but that's just me (; good luck!

Is it feasible to try to take both CS 162 and CS 188 over the summer? How much workload can I expect from that combo? What if I just took 162 alone without 188?
history.subject: CS 162 and CS 188 over the summer
